# AVCaption.TextCombine

**Enumeration**

The caption’s supported rendering policy options.

## Declaration

```swift
enum TextCombine
```

## Overview

Text combine is a special rendering policy that combines multiple characters into one unit and presents it in upright position in a vertical text flow. This presentation achieves a horizontal-in-vertical layout (or Tate-Chu-Yoko layout), which lets the caption render a horizontal text string in vertical text.

## Text combine options

- **AVCaption.TextCombine.all**: An option that combines all of the characters.
- **AVCaption.TextCombine.none**: An option that doesn’t combine text upright.
- **AVCaption.TextCombine.oneDigit**: An option that makes one digit upright.
- **AVCaption.TextCombine.twoDigits**: An option that combines two consecutive digits.
- **AVCaption.TextCombine.threeDigits**: An option that combines three consecutive digits.
- **AVCaption.TextCombine.fourDigits**: An option that combines four consecutive digits.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Accessing advanced typography

- **ruby(at:)**: Returns the ruby text at the index position.
- **AVCaption.Ruby**: An object that presents ruby characters.
- **textCombine(at:)**: Returns the text combine at the index position.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
